description:
Currently if the call out to the network service fails, we will return immediately without sending a usage-exists notification.

Since the `exists` notification can still be useful without the network info, a preferable behavior would be to send the `exists` notification but just omit (or blank out) the network parts of the message.
title: Don't drop exist notification if network call fails

comments.content:
Currently if the call out to the network service fails, we will return immediately without sending a usage-exists notification.

Since the `exists` notification can still be useful without the network info, a preferable behavior would be to send the `exists` notification but just omit (or blank out) the network parts of the message.
